botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause severe discomfort following ingestion, may cause an allergic skin reaction. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Tulipa are bulbous perennials with characteristic flowers, in a wide range of colours, in spring
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Kaufmanniana Group tulips are small, often with purple-marked foliage, and have single, often bicoloured flowers in early spring

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, well-drained soil in full sun. Protect from strong winds and excess winter wet. Kaufmanniana Group tulips may be left in the ground for several years, they do not need to be lifted annually. See tulip cultivation for more details
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division, separating offsets in summer. See bulb propagation for more details
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead after flowering and remove fallen petals
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to aphids, slugs and stem and bulb eelworm
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to tulip fire and virus diseases, and to bulb rot in poorly drained soils
